items.title: iPhone 16E: all the news on Apple’s new $599 phone
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Apple introduced the iPhone 16E, a successor to the iPhone SE, featuring a new design with Face ID and a notch.
- It is powered by Apple's A18 chip and comes equipped with the new C1 5G modem, claimed to be the most power-efficient modulator.
- The iPhone 16E has a 6.06-inch OLED display, customizable Action Button, USB-C port, no MagSafe support, and a single 48MP rear camera.
- Preorders start on February 21st, 2025, with a launch date set for February 28th, and prices starting at $599.

items.title: Google Chrome is adding a Circle to Search-like feature for iPhones
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google is introducing a new search feature for iPhone users in the Google app and Chrome browser, allowing them to highlight items on the screen for quick searches.
- The Lens gestures enable searches across text, images, and videos without needing screenshots or new tabs.
- This feature resembles Android’s Circle to Search, although iOS limitations restrict it to Google apps.
- Users can activate it via the three-dot menu and are encouraged to use intuitive gestures to highlight for searches.
- Upcoming updates will add a Lens icon to the address bar for quicker access.

items.title: Instagram Introduces Scheduled and Pinned DMs
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Instagram now allows users to schedule direct messages up to 29 days in advance.
- Users can pin up to three messages at the top of their chat for better visibility.
- New features aim to assist with messaging across time zones and to highlight important messages in busy chats.
- Additional features include inviting friends to group chats via QR codes and translating messages in 99 languages.
- Users can share music natively within the app, enabling shared listening experiences.

items.title: NetEase increases investment in Marvel Rivals despite recent layoffs
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Layoffs reported by developers of Marvel Rivals due to organizational streamlining.
- NetEase confirms its continued investment in the game's development despite layoffs.
- Recent success of Marvel Rivals raised over $130 million in revenue within its first month.
- Sources indicate underlying issues with confidence in overseas development teams following success of cheaper local projects.

items.title: Apple discontinues the iPhone 14
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Apple has stopped selling the iPhone 14, which was first released in 2022.
- The device disappeared from Apple's website after the launch of the iPhone 16E.
- The iPhone 14 was removed from the website’s navigation bar, and selecting it redirects to the iPhone homepage.
- The iPhone 16E starts at the same price of $599, offering upgrades like an A18 chip and a USB-C port.
- Apple began pulling the iPhone 14 from several European online stores due to new EU regulations enforcing USB-C ports.

items.title: Watch Apple show off the new iPhone 16E in its reveal video
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Apple revealed the iPhone 16E in a launch video instead of a full event.
- The iPhone 16E features the A18 chipset, Apple’s first in-house 5G modem, the C1, and a new design with Face ID.
- It has a 6.1-inch display, USB-C port, and customizable Action Button.
- The camera setup includes a 48-megapixel rear camera and a 12-megapixel front camera for Face ID.
- Preorders start this Friday with a release date of February 28th; pricing begins at $599 for 128GB storage.

items.title: Apple launches the iPhone 16E
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- The iPhone 16E features a design without the home button and replaces Touch ID with Face ID.
- Equipped with a 6.1-inch OLED display, it resembles the iPhone 14 in size but is larger than previous SE models.
- It includes an A18 chip, 128GB storage as standard, and a 48-megapixel rear camera.
- The device has swapped the Lightning port for USB-C, necessary for EU compliance.
- It is the first iPhone to feature an Apple-developed modem, signaling a shift from Qualcomm.
- Preorders start at $599, shipping on February 28th, marking a price increase from the previous iPhone SE.

items.title: The Cybertruck is the latest Tesla to score a 5-star crash rating
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- The Tesla Cybertruck received a 5-star crash safety rating from NHTSA after deliveries began in November 2023.
- The vehicle scored 5 stars in most categories including frontal, side crashes, and rollover risk.
- Driver seat center airbag deployed; knee airbags did not deploy during testing due to design specifications.
- In the side crash test, it earned an overall 5-star rating, and a 4-star rating for rollover risk with a 12.4% risk of rollover.
- Tesla conducted its own crash tests, but this is the first independent evaluation by regulators.
- Previously, other Tesla models (Model Y, Model 3, Model X, Model S) also achieved 5-star ratings.
- There are concerns about the Cybertruck's unique design affecting pedestrian safety; no pedestrian safety rating provided in NHTSA's evaluation.
- The Cybertruck has had seven recalls, addressing issues like the rear camera display and faulty windshield wipers.
- Sales have slowed down, prompting Tesla to offer discounts to boost demand.

items.title: Tesla Cybertruck Updates and News Highlights
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The Tesla Cybertruck scored a 5-star crash rating from NHTSA, receiving high marks in various categories including frontal and side crashes.
- Tesla marketed the Cybertruck as the best-selling electric pickup in 2024, yet is offering discounts ranging from $1,600 to $2,600 amidst concerns over demand.
- The Cybertruck has faced multiple recalls, the most recent concerning a potential inverter issue affecting propulsion.
- Tesla has halted sales of the RWD Cybertruck and increased prices for the AWD models, raising the entry price significantly from previous announcements.
- Reports surfaced of vandalized Cybertrucks, with over 30 vehicles spray-painted with derogatory messages towards Elon Musk.

items.title: Microsoft announces quantum computing breakthrough with new Majorana 1 chip
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft unveils Majorana 1 processor, a key advancement in quantum computing after 17 years of research.
- The Majorana 1 chip can potentially house a million qubits, using Majorana particles for computation.
- Microsoft introduces the world’s first topoconductor to control Majorana particles for more reliable qubits.
- A peer-reviewed paper in *Nature* outlines the creation of a topological qubit using a combination of indium arsenide and aluminum.
- The Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) selects Microsoft to develop a fault-tolerant quantum computer prototype within years.
- Microsoft aims for a million-qubit computer to solve significant global challenges, marking a pivotal step in the quest for useful quantum computing.

items.title: Eero announces its new Wi-Fi 7 line-up
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Eero introduces new Wi-Fi 7 mesh routers, Eero 7 and Eero Pro 7, available for preorder ahead of launch on February 26th.
- Pricing ranges from $169.99 (Eero 7) to $699.99 (Pro 7 three-pack).
- Eero 7 supports up to 1.8Gbps throughput; Pro 7 supports up to 3.9Gbps.
- Eero 7 is a dual-band router with two 2.5Gbps ethernet ports; Pro 7 includes a 6GHz band and dual 5Gbps ports.
- Both models feature enhanced Wi-Fi 7 capabilities like increased channel bandwidth and stability through multiple bands.
- They function as smart home hubs supporting Amazon’s Alexa and Matter, with backward compatibility to older Eero systems.

items.title: Microsoft’s Xbox AI era starts with a model that can generate gameplay
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft unveils the Muse AI model for Xbox, aiding game development and preservation of classic games.
- Muse generates game environments based on player actions, understanding 3D physics.
- The model trained on data from the game *Bleeding Edge*, utilizing seven years of gameplay data.
- Currently, Muse generates visuals at 300x180 pixels, a step up from previous models but still lower than standard gaming resolutions.
- Microsoft aims to enhance creativity in game development without replacing creators.

items.title: Apple’s first in-house iPhone modem is the C1
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple introduced the iPhone 16E, which features the new in-house 5G modem, C1.
- The C1 is touted as the most power-efficient modem and aims to reduce dependency on Qualcomm chips.
- The iPhone 16E will offer up to 26 hours of video playback, thanks to a larger battery design.
- The modem supports much of the same low-end 5G spectrum as the iPhone 16, but lacks mmWave capabilities.
- Preorders for the iPhone 16E start tomorrow, with shipping scheduled for February 28th.

items.title: Fiverr wants freelancers to create AI models
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Fiverr introduces a feature allowing creators to train AI models on their own work.
- Clients can buy access to these custom AI models for various services like voiceovers, songwriting, and digital marketing.
- Freelancers maintain control over their creative rights but similar results might occur for different users due to the nature of AI.
- Fiverr Go includes an AI personal assistant for creators to manage client interactions.
- Initial access to the suite is limited to top vetted freelancers to ensure quality.

items.title: EV truck maker Nikola goes bust
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Nikola is filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection and will sell off its assets.
- The company has $47 million in cash for the bankruptcy proceedings and listed assets between $500 million and $1 billion, with liabilities estimated between $1 billion and $10 billion.
- Allegations of fraud and the imprisonment of its founder, Trevor Milton, have marred its journey since its founding in 2015, which aimed to innovate in zero-emission heavy trucking.
- Nikola experienced significant challenges including inability to scale production and financial losses, leading to its latest bankruptcy filing.
- The company joins other failed EV startups, including Lordstown and Proterra, highlighting difficulties in the electric vehicle market.

items.title: From ChatGPT to Gemini: how AI is rewriting the internet
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- AI is confusing – here’s your cheat sheet.
- Figma explains how its AI tool ripped off Apple’s design.
- Early Apple tech bloggers are shocked to find their name and work have been AI-zombified.
- Google and OpenAI are racing to rewire the internet.
- We have to stop ignoring AI’s hallucination problem.
- OpenAI releases GPT-4o, a faster model that’s free for all ChatGPT users.
- The true promise of AI: Siri that doesn’t suck.
- Zuckerberg says it will take Meta years to make money from generative AI.
- Meta’s battle with ChatGPT begins now.
- Google apologizes for ‘missing the mark’ after Gemini generated racially diverse Nazis.
- One month with Microsoft’s AI vision of the future: Copilot Pro.
- How much electricity does AI consume?
- How AI copyright lawsuits could make the whole industry go extinct.
- Gemini Advanced is most impressive when it’s working with Google.
- Google’s AI now goes by a new name: Gemini.
- ChatGPT is winning the future — but what future is that?
- OpenAI is letting anyone create their own version of ChatGPT.
- Microsoft CTO Kevin Scott thinks Sydney might make a comeback.
- AI chatbots compared: Bard vs. Bing vs. ChatGPT.
- OpenAI announces GPT-4 — the next generation of its AI language model.

items.title: The women who made America’s microchips and the children who paid for it
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- The US aims to revive domestic chip manufacturing with ongoing concerns about health risks associated with past practices.
- Early semiconductor factory workers, mainly women, faced hazardous conditions leading to miscarriages and children with birth defects.
- Examples include Yvette and her son Mark, whose intellectual disabilities are attributed to exposure to harmful chemicals during production.
- Historical studies document higher miscarriage rates among semiconductor workers, prompting industry changes but lacking transparency.
- Recent reinvestment in US chipmaking raises fears about repeating past mistakes, with advocacy groups pushing for improved worker safety.

items.title: Nvidia GeForce RTX 5070 Ti review: a cheaper RTX 4080
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- RTX 5070 Ti priced at $749, competes with AMD RX 7900 XT at $899 and RX 7900 XTX at $999.
- 14% faster than RTX 4070 Ti at 4K, nearly matching RTX 4080 performance.
- Offers substantial performance for 4K gaming but pricing may rise post-launch on February 20th.
- Features less than 16GB of VRAM, which may limit future performance.
- Supports DLSS 4 and Multi Frame Generation technology, enhancing frame rates significantly.
- Comparatively efficient power usage, with average power draw similar to RTX 4070 Ti.

items.title: Everything we think we know about the next iPhone SE
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Apple is expected to launch a new iPhone SE today, possibly via its website rather than a full event.
- The new SE may feature a design similar to the iPhone 14, eliminating the home button and introducing Face ID.
- It is rumored to have a 6.1-inch OLED display, up from the previous 4.7-inch size, and will include a customizable Action button.
- The phone will likely use a USB-C port instead of Lightning to conform with EU regulations.
- Internally, it is expected to be powered by the A18 chip, with 8GB of RAM, and a starting price around $500.

items.title: The Humane AI Pin never had a chance
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- The Humane AI Pin is being shut down, leaving owners with a useless $699 device.
- HP acquired some of Humane's technology for $116 million, significantly less than the $230 million raised by Humane since its founding.
- The device launched with major functionality issues and disappointing performance despite initial hype and promises of being the future of AI gadgets.

items.title: This smart video lock unlocks with a wave of your hand
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Eufy has launched the $399 FamiLock S3 Max, a smart lock using palm vein recognition.
- It features a 2K camera and a screen for live video feed, works over Wi-Fi 6, and is compatible with Matter.
- Supports up to 50 palm prints stored locally; can also be unlocked via keycode, app, or physical key.
- Contains a 15,000mAh removable rechargeable battery, with 6-12 months battery life.
- The camera has a 150-degree vertical and 180-degree diagonal field of view, with 8GB of onboard storage for recorded footage.
- Launching on March 17; pre-orders available for existing customers at a $70 discount.

items.title: Trump’s first 100 days: all the news affecting the tech industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- A federal judge declined to block Elon Musk's DOGE from accessing government data and further staff reductions.
- Judge Tanya Chutkan ruled that the states failed to demonstrate irreparable harm.
- Musk was found not to be directly involved with DOGE's operations, stating he is part of the White House Office as a senior advisor.
- DOGE is attempting to access IRS taxpayer data, which includes sensitive personal information.
- Over 386 videos have been removed from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau's YouTube channel under the Trump administration's policies.

items.title: All the smart home news, reviews, and gadgets you need to know about
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The smart home can enhance convenience, security, and energy efficiency through various gadgets.
- New gadgets and features are constantly emerging, making it hard to keep track.
- The article features ongoing updates, reviews, and news from major players like Apple, Amazon, and Google about their smart home tech.
- Notable tech advances include Matter, Thread, and UWB, aimed at improving device connectivity and ease of use in smart homes.
- The TM7 smart multi-cooker is set to launch in Europe first and in the US by late 2025, promising innovative features like voice control.
- Apple is reportedly exploring a home robot focusing more on user experience rather than humanoid design.

items.title: Reddit vs. Wall Street: the latest in the GameStop saga
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- GameStop announces plans to sell its operations in Canada and France due to factors cited as "wokeness and DEI" by CEO Ryan Cohen.
- E*Trade considers shutting down the account of Keith Gill, a prominent figure in the WallStreetBets community, amidst speculations of market manipulation.
- Gill's previous involvement in the GameStop frenzy of 2021 led to an uptick in stock prices again, raising concerns from the SEC regarding potential manipulation.

items.title: Elden Ring: the latest updates on FromSoftware's mega-hit
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Hidetaka Miyazaki acknowledged that Erdtree is notably challenging.
- The new DLC, Shadow of the Erdtree, adds substantial volume comparable to parts of the base game.
- Final boss in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC has been nerfed following feedback regarding difficulty.
- Players report an overwhelming challenge with the new content, prompting a calibration update to make gameplay easier.
- Elden Ring’s soundtrack is now available on major streaming platforms.

items.title: FTC Chair praises Justice Thomas as ‘the most important judge of the last 100 years’ for Black History Month
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- FTC Chair Andrew Ferguson praised Justice Clarence Thomas in a memo for Black History Month, calling him the most important judge of the last 100 years.
- Ferguson emphasized Thomas's success despite a difficult upbringing, stating he embodies the American spirit of overcoming adversity.
- The memo indicated Ferguson may align his policies with Thomas, especially regarding consumer protection cases involving potential racial bias in technology.
- Ferguson has already distanced himself from prior FTC chair Lina Khan’s approach, declaring a halt to diversity initiatives at the agency.

items.title: DOGE can keep accessing government data for now, judge rules
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- A US federal judge allowed Elon Musk's DOGE to access data from seven government agencies.
- The judge denied a temporary restraining order sought by 14 Democratic state attorneys general, citing insufficient evidence of irreparable harm.
- The case raises questions about Musk's appointment under the Appointments Clause, indicating potential executive abuses.
- The states may still pursue the case on its merits and seek a preliminary injunction against DOGE's data access.

items.title: Humane’s AI Pin: All the Latest News on the Failing Wearable
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Humane is recalling the AI Pin’s charging case due to overheating concerns.
- Daily returns of the AI Pin are outpacing sales since its launch.
- A review claims the AI Pin does not meet expectations.
- Users should backup data before February 28, 2025, when AI Pin features will cease functioning.
- Humane is selling its AI technology to HP for $116 million and will no longer sell the AI Pin.
- The AI Pin was priced at $699 and faced criticism for its performance and usability.
- Customers are encouraged to stop using the charging case due to fire risks associated with the battery.

items.title: Humane is shutting down the AI Pin and selling its remnants to HP
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Humane is selling its AI capabilities to HP for $116 million and discontinuing the AI Pin.
- AI Pins will function until 3PM ET on February 28, 2025, after which they will lose connectivity to Humane’s servers and many features.
- Refunds for AI Pins are available within 90 days from shipment, and prorated refunds for subscriptions past the shutdown date will be processed.
- HP will acquire Humane’s platform Cosmos, technical talent, and extensive intellectual property.
- The AI Pin faced poor sales and negative reviews, leading Humane to seek acquisition shortly after its launch.

items.title: Marvel Rivals’ US team is undergoing layoffs
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Marvel Rivals, a multiplayer shooter, laid off an unspecified number of US employees following its December 2024 launch.
- The game reached 20 million players shortly after its release but still faced layoffs.
- Laid-off employees expressed their disappointment on LinkedIn, highlighting the success of the game and contrasting it with the company's decision.
- Player reactions included negative reviews on Steam, with over 300 out of 1,000 reviews being critical.

items.title: Facebook is about to mass delete a lot of old live streams
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Facebook will delete live broadcast recordings after **30 days** starting on **February 19th**.  
- Users must download videos within 30 days to prevent deletion; clips can also be shared as **Reels** with a 90-second limit.  
- Notifications will be sent before deletion, allowing **90 days** to save videos; deletion will happen in waves.  
- Facebook provides download tools for saving individual or bulk videos, with options to transfer to cloud services like **Dropbox** or **Google Drive**.  
- A postpone request feature allows users an additional **six months** to save their videos.

items.title: Google Meet's AI transcripts will automatically create action items for you
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Google Meet introduces a Gemini-powered note-taking feature for Workspace teams that generates action items post-meeting.
- The feature rolls out on **February 18, 2025**, suggesting next steps with due dates and assigned stakeholders.
- Gemini's transcription separates speakers and summarizes discussions, sharing the output in a structured Google Doc with participants.

items.title: GTA VI: all the news on Rockstar’s next entry in the Grand Theft Auto series
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Rockstar announced the first trailer for GTA VI will be revealed on December 5, 2023, but leaked early.  
- The game will return to Vice City, featuring a new protagonist named Lucia.  
- In 2022, hacker Arion Kurtaj leaked 90 videos related to the game, leading to his conviction in 2023.  
- There are unconfirmed reports of recent leaks showing gameplay footage and maps allegedly from a Rockstar employee's child.  
- Reports suggest Rockstar is focusing on user-generated content by collaborating with creators from games like Fortnite and Roblox.  
- GTA VI is set to launch in Fall 2025, with GTA V having sold over 210 million copies.  
- The reveal trailer of GTA VI has garnered record-breaking views, surpassing earlier GTA V's trailer views in a matter of hours.

items.title: Rockstar’s working on bringing Roblox creators to GTA VI
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Rockstar is focusing on user-generated content for the upcoming game, GTA VI, set to be released in fall 2025.
- Discussions are underway with creators from Fortnite and Roblox to develop custom experiences within the game.
- Interest in the GTA series has remained high, thanks to modifications like FiveM, which allows player-hosted multiplayer servers.
- Rockstar previously banned FiveM creators in 2015 but later acquired the team in 2023 as user-generated content gained popularity.
- The strategy aims to ensure GTA VI's success in a competitive gaming marketplace by leveraging the popularity of platforms that support creator content.

items.title: Amazon scraps its TikTok-style Inspire feed
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Amazon has officially discontinued its Inspire feature, which was similar to TikTok.  
- The feature allowed users to view and purchase products through a social media-style feed.  
- Inspire was launched in 2022, paralleling similar shopping features being introduced by TikTok and other platforms.  
- Creators criticized Amazon for offering low payment rates for content on the platform.  
- Amazon plans to innovate further in social media integrations for product discovery and recommendations.

items.title: It’s clearly time: all the news about the transparent tech renaissance
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Leaked images reveal Sony's new transparent color option for their ANC earbuds, the WF-C710N, set to launch in late May with features like [Sony’s Quick Attention Mode](https://helpguide.sony.net/mdr/2963/v1/en/contents/TP1000781422.html).
- The WF-C710N will be available in four colors, including a new glass blue with a fully transparent design for the buds and charging case.
- Retro Remake has opened preorders for the SuperStation One ($149.99 Founders Edition sold out; standard price $225, currently $179.99), designed like the PS One but with FPGA capabilities for multiple console emulations.
- Xbox announced the Pulse Cipher Special Edition controller, featuring a deep-red transparent casing, priced at $74.99 and available on February 4th.
- Asus introduced a NUC AI mini PC with a color E Ink display, further expanding transparent tech possibilities.

items.title: US tariffs: how Trump’s tax is hitting Big Tech and beyond
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Automakers brace for the massive impact of Trump’s tariffs on vehicles.
- Trump imposes sweeping tariffs on imports from Canada, Mexico, and China.
- Acer announces a predicted 10% increase in laptop prices due to the tariffs, warning of potential price gouging among competitors.
- Small businesses in the US report increased manufacturing costs as a direct result of tariffs, prompting price hikes for consumers.
- The de minimis exemption, allowing duty-free import for goods valued under $800, has been paused, leading to confusion and additional fees on low-value shipments from China.

items.title: Longer-lasting laptops: the modular hardware you can upgrade and repair yourself
Acer is the first to raise laptop prices because of Trump
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Acer CEO Jason Chen announced a 10% price increase on laptops in the US starting next month due to President Trump's import tax on goods from China.
- The price hike is deemed straightforward, and Acer made the decision last week, affecting laptops but not desktops, as manufacturing is already outside China for those products.
- Chen suggested that other companies may exploit the tariff situation to raise prices even more than 10%.

items.title: Electricity demand surges for the world’s two biggest polluters
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- The International Energy Agency (IEA) forecasts a significant increase in electricity demand from China and the US over the next few years, fueled by data centers and electric vehicle manufacturing.
- Global electricity demand growth is expected to be equivalent to adding Japan’s annual consumption each year until 2027, with developing economies like China driving much of the increase.
- China’s electricity usage has outpaced its economic growth since 2020, particularly due to the solar, EV, and battery sectors, while US demand is anticipated to rise by 2% annually through 2027, driven by data center needs.
- The IEA emphasizes the need for cleaner energy sources to meet rising electricity demands without increasing pollution, with renewable energy predicted to account for a significant portion of new electricity generation.

items.title: Mira Murati is launching her OpenAI rival: Thinking Machines Lab
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- Mira Murati, ex-CTO of OpenAI, is launching a new AI startup called [Thinking Machines Lab](https://thinkingmachines.ai/).
- The startup aims to make AI systems more understandable, customizable, and capable, with a commitment to public transparency through regular publication of technical research and code.
- Murati has recruited notable figures from OpenAI, including co-founder John Schulman and CTO Barrett Zoph, building a team of about 10 top researchers from elite AI labs.

items.title: Three months later, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 is the glorious pain in the ass its makers intended
items.author: Lewis Gordon
items.summary:
- Release of *S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl* initially criticized for lacking life and activity in the game world.
- After three months, two major and five smaller patches have significantly improved enemy AI and reduced bugs.
- Enhanced AI leads to more dynamic combat situations and immersive experiences, bringing the game's environment to life.
- Latest patch includes 1,700 improvements, including level design tweaks and better NPC behavior, such as looting.
- Developers express commitment to improving the game post-launch, highlighting its essence and emotional resonance with players.

items.title: WhatsApp is now a Very Large platform in the EU, and will face tougher regulation
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- WhatsApp has exceeded 45 million users, qualifying it as a Very Large Online Platform (VLOP) under the EU’s Digital Services Act (DSA).
- The designation subjects WhatsApp to stricter regulations including user reporting tools for illegal content and restrictions on targeted advertising.
- WhatsApp's monthly active users were approximately 46.8 million as of February 14, 2024, according to a recent filing.
- Facebook and Instagram are already classified as VLOPs in the EU, facing similar regulations.

items.title: Magic: The Gathering’s Final Fantasy sets will tell the stories of the games
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Magic: The Gathering revealed its upcoming Final Fantasy-themed set.
- The initial look includes character cards from Final Fantasy games with associated pre-constructed Commander decks.
- Cards featured include Terra, Tidus, Y’shtola, and Cloud, each deck narrating a specific Final Fantasy game's story.
- The full set will represent all 16 mainline Final Fantasy games and launches on June 13th, 2024.
- Art by famous Final Fantasy artist Yoshitaka Amano will feature in the set.

items.title: All of Chipolo's Bluetooth trackers are discounted in sitewide sale
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- All Chipolo trackers are currently discounted.
- Use code **THEVERGE10** for additional savings.
- A four-pack of **Chipolo One Spot** trackers is now $56.70, a saving of about $55.
- Single **Chipolo Card Spot** available for $26.10, a $9 discount.
- **Chipolo One Point** and **Chipolo Card Point** are also on sale.
- Original trackers do not support Apple's Find My or Google’s Find My Device networks, but offer perks in Chipolo’s app.

items.title: The hunt for the next Twitter: all the news about alternative social media platforms
Meta’s new ‘LlamaCon’ event will focus on AI
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- LlamaCon will take place on April 29, 2025, focusing on updates regarding open-source AI developments.
- This event is planned ahead of Meta Connect, which will run from September 17 to 18, 2025.
- More information about LlamaCon will be shared in the coming weeks; the event aims to assist developers in creating AI-driven applications and products.
- Meta is investing billions in AI in 2025 and may launch new smart glasses with advanced features soon.

items.title: Insta360’s new gimbal add-on brings subject tracking to any camera app
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Insta360 introduces the Flow 2 Pro AI Tracker, enabling any camera app to use its AI tracking technology.
- The AI Tracker works independently, allowing recording or streaming with any smartphone app, while stabilizing video and framing subjects automatically.
- It features gesture controls, an LED fill light, and draws power from the Flow 2 Pro gimbal instead of having its own battery.
- The AI Tracker is priced at $39.99, or $20 when bundled with the Flow 2 Pro for $179.

items.title: Chase will start blocking Zelle payments over social media
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Starting March 23rd, 2025, Chase will decline or block Zelle payments originated from social media.
- This policy aims to reduce scams associated with online marketplaces and messaging apps.
- Customers may need to provide more information when adding new Zelle recipients to combat potential fraud.
- The policy follows a lawsuit by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau regarding consumer protection issues related to Zelle.
- Reports indicate that 50% of scams in late 2024 were linked to social media, highlighting the risks involved in using Zelle for transactions with unknown users.

items.title: Nothing compares Phone 3A camera with iPhone 16 Pro Max
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Nothing released a YouTube video comparing the Phone 3A's 50MP periscope camera to the iPhone 16 Pro Max's camera.
- The Phone 3A features 3X optical zoom and up to 60x ultra zoom compared to the iPhone's 5X optical zoom.
- The Phone 3A's main camera captures 64% more light at a pixel level than the previous model.
- The video includes comparisons of outdoor photos between the two devices.
- Nothing will officially unveil the Phone 3A on March 4th, 2024.
